definition: to invite/to make an appointment
to invite/to request/to intercept/to solicit/to seek
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: I loafe and invite my soul, I lean and loafe at my ease observing a spear of summer grass.
sentences.chinese: 我流浪，并邀约我的灵魂，悠然俯看一片夏天的草叶。

sentences.english: Begeristain has there been made an offer that 'cannot be refused'.
sentences.chinese: 贝吉里斯坦已经收到一份“不可拒绝”的邀约。

sentences.english: Women wearing the color red were also more likely to receive a prom invitation and be treated to a more expensive date or night out.
sentences.chinese: 着红装的女性也因此更易收到舞会或烛光晚餐的邀约。

sentences.english: Accept an invitation you wouldn't normally.
sentences.chinese: 接受一个你一般不会接受的邀约。

sentences.english: Even the most interesting game should not keep you from going out with the family or friends.
sentences.chinese: 游戏再好玩，你也不该无视家人或朋友的邀约。

sentences.english: But it is hard to see who might want to take up Mr Henderson's offer just now.
sentences.chinese: 可现在还看不出有谁想接受汉德森的邀约。

sentences.english: He even used the site to ask out a girl.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至还在站点上邀约女孩子。
